Silāyupa Sutta：Sāriputta tells the monks that when a monk is wholly freed，objects，sounds，scents，etc．，that come within the range of his senses，cannot overwhelm his mind．It is like a stone column ten cubits long，one half of it buried in the ground，which cannot be shaken by the wind．

The sutta was preached as the result of a conversation between Sāriputta andCandikāputta regarding the teachings ofDevadatta．A．iv．402f．
